text: Chi-squared test: Assumes the null hypothesis is correct (that all the studies are homogeneous/ there is no difference) and gives a p-value to test this hypothesis. P value <0.1 is the cut off. <0.1 = bad. 12: The % variation due to heterogeneity rather than chance. >50% = bad Tau? The extent of variation among the effects observed in different studies. Reported with a P value <0.1 considered significant. le <0.1 = Bad.
